quest.name: Problematic Pests
journal:
 Quest Sync
Now that he's being understood at last, Shaggles is full of vim and vigor.

You ask for Shaggles's advice on the case. He suggests that you show the woodworm sample he's brought along to one better versed in such scientific matters, so you head off in search of one of the biologists at Meryall Agronomics.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level.

The biologist confirms Shaggles's suspicions that the woodworm is indeed a new species, and suggests you learn more about its origins should you wish to effectively rid the Archeion of the vilekin. Shaggles remarks that he found the pest attached to a tool used to make medicine that was procured by a Roegadyn gleaner, who might still be found at the Archeion.
The gleaner explains that she procured the infested tool from the Great Work in Thavnair. This latest discovery calls for another trip to Meryall Agronomics.
The biologist explains that it's no surprise that the pest is resistant to the usual alchemical pesticide, as it too was created in Thavnair. As for a solution...he appears yet uncertain.
objectives: Speak with the Agronomics biologist again.

dialogue.name: NWELHITIA
dialogue.text: Your help is indispensable if we're to get Shaggles's advice on dealing with the infestation.

dialogue.name: LITTLETROLL
dialogue.text: Allow me to explain a few things first. Staff at the Archeion regularly use alchemic pesticides to keep the place free of harmful grrrs.

dialogue.name: LITTLETROLL
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, the woodworm I found seemed to be entirely resistant to the type of pesticide employed at the facility.

dialogue.name: LITTLETROLL
dialogue.text: I skimmed a few tomes, including the New Eorzean Geographic, but I couldn't manage to identify the vilekin in the Archeion. I'm guessing it must be a new species. Grrr...

dialogue.name: LITTLETROLL
dialogue.text: We won't get very far if we know nothing about the enemy, so I went ahead and captured one of the woodworms. We can try showing it to someone who knows more about this sort of thing than I do.

dialogue.name: NWELHITIA
dialogue.text: I see. In that case, I think we'd be best served by a biologist at Meryall Agronomics. Shall we?

dialogue.name: LITTLETROLL
dialogue.text: Don't grrr at me. I can't talk to him myself.

dialogue.name: NWELHITIA
dialogue.text: I went ahead and told him everything. I have to admit that I hesitated to bring up Shaggles's role, though.

dialogue.name: BIORESEARCHER
dialogue.text: Your troll showed me the woodworm sample, but the best I can do is confirm that I've never seen it before. I'd say your hypothesis that it's an undiscovered species is highly likely.

dialogue.name: BIORESEARCHER
dialogue.text: In order to ascertain how best to deal with the insect, we would need to learn about its original habitat.

dialogue.name: LITTLETROLL
dialogue.text: Grrr... Well, I found it clinging on to a Thavnairian tool used to make medicine that was recently brought to the Archeion.

dialogue.name: LITTLETROLL
dialogue.text: It was delivered by a Roegadyn gleaner. Let's go ask grrr about it.

dialogue.name: BIORESEARCHER
dialogue.text: That troll truly speaks to you, doesn't it? Perhaps that woodworm is not the only new species in our midst...

dialogue.name: NWELHITIA
dialogue.text: Well, what are we waiting for then? To the Archeion!

dialogue.name: BIORESEARCHER
dialogue.text: Now that I think of it, there was a vilekin race capable of conversing. The Gnath, if I'm not mistaken... Though some argue that they're closer to crustaceans.

dialogue.name: LITTLETROLL
dialogue.text: That's the gleaner who delivered the tool. Let's ask her where she got it.

dialogue.name: NWELHITIA
dialogue.text: I wonder if I'll be able to talk to Shaggles someday too. I'd love to know what he thinks of me...

dialogue.name: GLEANER04481
dialogue.text: Oh, that? I found that in Thavnair.

dialogue.name: GLEANER04481
dialogue.text: To be more specific, at the alchemists' outpost─the Great Work.

dialogue.name: GLEANER04481
dialogue.text: 'Twas used by the first alchemists, they say, and there are few tools like it still extant. I spent days arguing my case before its owner agreed to hand it over.

dialogue.name: LITTLETROLL
dialogue.text: Grrr... It's all coming together now. The woodworm was probably exposed to so many alchemic concoctions in that settlement that it developed a hardy resistance to substances like the pesticide.

dialogue.name: LITTLETROLL
dialogue.text: Let's waste no time in grrring the biologist about this.

dialogue.name: GLEANER04481
dialogue.text: I feel like I've seen that little troll in the Archeion. Is it all right for him to be out and about like this?

dialogue.name: NWELHITIA
dialogue.text: Ah, well, circumstances have required us to set him free for a bit. Closely monitored, of course. Now, where did he go...?

dialogue.name: NWELHITIA
dialogue.text: Oh my. We should make for Meryall Agronomics straightaway, then!

dialogue.name: GLEANER04481
dialogue.text: If I didn't know better, I could've sworn that troll was talking to you...

dialogue.name: LITTLETROLL
dialogue.text: Grrr... Go on, then.

dialogue.name: NWELHITIA
dialogue.text: I suppose I should really return Shaggles to the Archeion soon... Oh, ignore me. I'm just thinking out loud.

dialogue.name: BIORESEARCHER
dialogue.text: Well, that certainly makes a lot of sense in light of all that's happened thus far.

dialogue.name: BIORESEARCHER
dialogue.text: I happen to know that the alchemic pesticide used at the Archeion was created in Thavnair, so it's hardly surprising that our woodworm friend has developed a resistance to it.

dialogue.name: BIORESEARCHER
dialogue.text: Hmm, now how shall we solve this conundrum...
